title: 11 Ways to Add Rose Water to Your Skincare & Beauty Routine

steps.title: Use rosewater as a toner.
steps.content: Use rosewater as a toner. Rose water has astringent, soothing, and moisturizing properties, which makes it an excellent all-natural toner option, explains Joanna Kula, licensed esthetician and owner of Skin Devotee Facial Studio in Philadelphia. [1] X Expert Source Joanna Kula Licensed Esthetician Expert Interview. 9 July 2019. First, wash your face with a gentle cleanser and dry it with a clean towel. If you have rose water spray , hold it about 6 inches (15 cm) from your face, and spritz it all over your skin. If your rose water is in a regular bottle, wet a cotton ball with the liquid and gently swipe it across your skin until you’ve covered your whole face. Let the rose water air dry, and that’s it! You can now move on to the rest of your skincare routine.

steps.title: Use rosewater to prep your skin for makeup.
steps.content: Use rosewater to prep your skin for makeup. Rose water hydrates and soothes redness, which makes it a great base for your foundation. Before applying your makeup, wet a cotton ball with rose water and swipe it all over your face, or spritz your face with rose water spray. Next, apply your makeup as normal. Your foundation should go on super smoothly and evenly! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Make a homemade face mask with rosewater.
steps.content: Make a homemade face mask with rosewater. With its anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, and hydrating properties, rose water makes an excellent ingredient for a soothing face mask. [3] X Research source If you're making a DIY face mask recipe , try using rose water instead of regular water to reap its benefits. You can also add a few drops of rose water as an extra ingredient to your face mask if the recipe doesn’t call for water. There are also rose water face masks available to purchase, if you don’t want to make your own.

steps.title: Apply rosewater underneath a sheet mask.
steps.content: Apply rosewater underneath a sheet mask. Before applying your favorite sheet mask , spritz your face with a generous amount of rose water. [4] X Research source This will boost your sheet mask’s hydrating effects, while also locking in the soothing, anti-inflammatory properties of the rose water.

steps.title: Mist your face with rosewater to cool down.
steps.content: Mist your face with rosewater to cool down. A quick spray of rose water can be super soothing, especially on a hot day. Simply spritz your face with the rose water for a quick pick-me-up whenever you’re feeling flushed, hot, or sweaty. You can even keep your rose water in the fridge to make it extra cooling and refreshing!

steps.title: Apply rose water to soothe razor burn.
steps.content: Apply rose water to soothe razor burn. Rose water can help calm skin irritation and inflammation. [5] X Research source This makes it a great treatment for razor burn. After shaving, spray your rose water directly onto your skin, or apply it with a cotton ball. Your skin should feel instantly soothed and hydrated!

steps.title: Apply rose water on minor cuts and scrapes.
steps.content: Apply rose water on minor cuts and scrapes. Though this hasn’t been studied extensively, the antibacterial and antimicrobial properties of rose water may be beneficial for small skin injuries. [6] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source These properties may help minor cuts and burns heal more quickly, while also fighting off infection. Always practice proper wound care when you have a skin injury. This means thoroughly washing the wound, applying an antibiotic ointment or petroleum jelly, and covering the area with a bandage. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you decide to use rose water on a minor cut, try applying it in the days following the injury to aid in the healing process.

steps.title: Use rose water on your hair and scalp.
steps.content: Use rose water on your hair and scalp. Rose water can soothe an irritated scalp while also promoting hydration, which leads to healthier, shinier hair. [8] X Research source To capitalize on these benefits, simply mix equal parts rose water and regular water, and apply it to your hair and scalp. You can put this mixture in a spray bottle and spritz it on your scalp as a leave-in treatment, or you can pour it over your head in the shower after washing your hair. [9] X Research source You can also purchase shampoos , conditioners , or hair masks that contain rose water.

steps.title: Add rose water to your bath.
steps.content: Add rose water to your bath. In addition to its skincare benefits, rose water has a beautiful floral scent. This makes it a wonderful addition when you’re taking a relaxing bubble bath . The rose water’s scent will perfume your body and hair, and your skin will also reap its hydrating and soothing benefits. Simply fill your bathtub up with water, pour in a bit of rose water, and enjoy!

steps.title: Use rose water for aromatherapy.
steps.content: Use rose water for aromatherapy. Some research suggests that the scent of rose water reduces anxiety and boosts your mood. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source To experience these benefits throughout the day, spritz rose water on your face, or apply it to your wrists and neck like a perfume. You can also spray your pillow with rose water before you go to bed at night to enjoy the soothing and relaxing floral scent.

steps.title: Make food or beverages with rosewater.
steps.content: Make food or beverages with rosewater. Due to its pleasant floral flavor, rose water is a popular ingredient in cooking. It is often used to flavor desserts and baked goods, such as cookies, cakes, cupcakes, and candies. It’s also a common ingredient for sweet beverages, like cocktails, mocktails, teas, and coffee drinks. [11] X Research source If you want to try adding rose water to food or beverages, make sure you’re using an edible rose water product , not a skincare rose water product! You should be able to find rose water for cooking at grocery or health food stores, but you can also make your own rose water , if you prefer.

steps.title: Soothes skin irritation and redness
steps.content: Soothes skin irritation and redness Research shows that rose has anti-inflammatory properties. [12] X Research source Because of this, rose water may be helpful for soothing skin irritation from razor burn, eczema, rosacea, and other similar conditions.

steps.title: Hydrates & moisturizes
steps.content: Hydrates & moisturizes Rose water is known for its hydrating and soothing properties, which makes it a great ingredient for a refreshing facial mist or body moisturizer. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Clarifies, tones, & fights bacteria
steps.content: Clarifies, tones, & fights bacteria Rose is a natural astringent, and it has antimicrobial effects. [14] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source It’s also thought to reduce oil production and minimize the appearance of pores. [15] X Research source With all this in mind, it’s no wonder that rose water is such a popular facial toner, especially for those with acne-prone skin.

steps.title: Has antioxidant & anti-aging properties
steps.content: Has antioxidant & anti-aging properties Research shows that rose has anti-collagenase and anti-elastase properties. [16] X Research source Collagenase and elastase are proteins that break down collagen and elastin, and inhibiting the activity of these proteins may lead to more youthful looking skin. [17] X Research source Rose water also contains antioxidants, which are known to have powerful anti-aging properties for skin. [18] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source

steps.title: Reduces anxiety & enhances mood
steps.content: Reduces anxiety & enhances mood In the practice of aromatherapy, rose has been found to reduce anxiety levels and increase a sense of comfort and satisfaction. [19] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source The scent may also reduce symptoms of depression. [20] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Soothes pain and physical ailments
steps.content: Soothes pain and physical ailments These effects haven’t all been confirmed by scientific research, but rose has traditionally been used to treat digestive problems, soothe menstrual pain, reduce inflammation, ease coughs, and treat minor skin wounds. It has also been utilized as a gentle laxative. [21] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source
